intro: Fallopia, commonly known as cowhead, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. These plants are characterized by their slender, often climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. They are typically found in temperate regions and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Some species produce small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Fallopia species are sometimes considered invasive in certain areas due to their rapid growth and ability to spread aggressively.
